I started this many moons ago: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/pull/1733/. But its completely disappeared from the radar, which leads me to think its not that desired. What you think? Anyone ever thought would be nice to have in the last 5 years?

Relationships by docwilmot · Pull Request #1733 · backdrop/backdrop
Fixes backdrop/backdrop-issues#2134 An initial idea for starters creates a Relationship Class which can be extended by Relationship plugins. only a user_from_node plugin is included so far all pos...

@docwilmot - I know that we live in a time of social distancing, but I'm not yet ready to give up on relationships entirely.

;-)
I would love to have this. I have done that with panels on D7 sites in the past, and I was never quite sure how to do it in Backdrop

If it worked with fields from https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/reference to allow nested relationships, that would be even better.

backdrop-contrib/reference
Defines a field to allow Backdrop entities to reference each other. - backdrop-contrib/reference

StPaulTim said:

docwilmot - I know that we live in a time of social distancing, but I'm not yet ready to give up on relationships entirely.

;-)

Haha, best Backdrop pun of the year!

On a more serious note...

I think that field blocks are one of the most powerful features in Backdrop that most casual users are not aware of. This would make them even more powerful. I don't think that this option has even occurred to me before. I suspect that if I were aware of it as a possibility, I would use it.
I feel like I should know what field blocks are but I don't.

@Justin Keiser create a new layout -> set its context to node/% -> head to the block management of that layout -> click "Add block" on any region -> search for blocks with field names, like "body" or "image" ...this means that you can render nodes of type "Post" and have the body in the main content region, while rendering the image in the sidebar :wink: ...let your creativity run wild!

https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/3530
